intro: Ormocarpum acuminatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf orache, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, triangular leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, club-shaped fruits. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Ormocarpum acuminatum is adapted to arid conditions and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy species in Mediterranean climates.
